title: Newton Ferrers Walking Route

images.title: Martin Bodman / Newton and Noss: Newton Ferrers, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Newton and Noss: Newton Ferrers. With the tide coming in and the tower of the church of the Holy Cross in shadow on the hill above, beyond the square

images.title: Martin Bodman / Newton and Noss: Newton Ferrers, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Newton and Noss: Newton Ferrers House - or cottages - line Newton Creek. Seen from Noss Mayo, with the tide out.

images.title: Robin Mealing / Newton Ferrers, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Newton Ferrers. From South bank of River Yealm looking west

images.title: Gwyn Jones / Water Frontage, Newton Ferrers, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Water Frontage, Newton Ferrers. Low and late afternoon lighting provides a strong reflection of a mirror image of the International Paints Research establishment and the waterside properties of Newton Ferrers, as viewed from Warren Point.

images.title: Tony Atkin / On Revelstoke Drive, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: On Revelstoke Drive. The coast path follows this wide track called Revelstoke Drive which runs around the coast for eight miles. It was built in the 1880s by the local landowner to give visitors a spectacular carriage ride.

images.title: Derek Harper / Gara Point, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gara Point. Above this headland the coast path, from which the photo was taken, swings north towards the Yealm estuary.

images.title: Tony Atkin / Cliffside near Gara Point, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cliffside near Gara Point. The coastal slope here is covered with a mixture of gorse and grasses. Sheep are grazed on this land.

images.title: Roger Cornfoot / Gara Point, on Wembury Bay, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gara Point, on Wembury Bay. The Great Mew Stone can be seen, in the distance, out at sea.

description: This pretty village in South Devon is in a great location for coastal walking. This circular walk visits the neighbouring village of Noss Mayo before exploring the lovely Gara Point Yealm Estuary using a section of the long distance South West Coast Path. Starting in the village you cross the Newton Creek on the ferry to Noss Mayo. From here you can follow footpaths south to Blackstone Point. Here you can pick up the South West Coast Path and follow it to Gara Point. It's a lovely spot with wildflowers, green fields, gorse and wonderful views to Wembury Bay, Plymouth Sound and the Mewstone. The route continues north east along the coast path back towards Noss Mayo and the ferry crossing. To continue your walking in the area you can head west to the village of Wembury and then on to Wembury Point. It's a splendid area with spectacular coastal cliffs and a variety of wildlife. You can look out for Dartmoor Ponies, basking sharks, porpoises, dolphins and many different types of birds from this stretch of coast. If you were to head east you would soon come to the beautiful Erme Estuary .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head into nearby Yealmpton and you could visit the 400 year old Mother Hubbard's cottage. The quaint old dwelling provided the inspiration for the famous nursery rhyme.

display_address: Newton Voss, Noss Mayo, Newton and Noss, Newton Ferrers, South Hams, Devon, England, PL8 1AB, United Kingdom
